qas.question: I would like to open an account with my son, do u have any product for kids?
answer: Main

Yes our product is Little Champs Account. It is designed specifically for minors (individuals below the age of 18 years). A child requires the help of a parental/legal guardian to open this account and avail its facilities. Little Champs get a Debit Card and chequebook which is free the first time

Little Champs Savings A/C

Daily funds Transfer Limit:     Rs.100,000/-

* For Current Account only

qas.question: What other Value added features does the Little Champs Account have?
answer: Attractive returns on savings account
SMS alert service on digital transactions

answer: This account is opened in the name of the minor. However, a minor needs a guardian’s help to avail the account’s facilities

qas.question: What documents are required to open a Little Champs Account.
answer: ·        A photocopy of Form-B, Birth Certificate or Student ID card (as appropriate) of the minor
·        A photocopy of any one of the following valid identity documents of the guardian of the minor:
1.      Computerized National Identity Card (CNIC) issued by NADRA
2.      National Identity Card for Overseas Pakistani (NICOP) issued by NADRA
3.      Pakistan Origin Card (POC) issued by NADRA
4.      Alien Registration Card (ARC) issued by National Aliens Registration Authority (NARA), Ministry of Interior (local currency account only)
5.      Passport, with a valid visa or any other proof of legal stay along with passport (foreign national individuals only)
6.   Source of income of guardian

Principal amount x 1.5% per annum on the remaining period of the Term Deposits

answer: ·        Salaried Individuals
·        Specially Abled Persons/Visually Impaired Person/Persons with Disabilities (PWD)
·        Self Employed Businessman/Woman (SEB)
·        Individuals having any other verifiable source of income

qas.question: 3. Which types of Vehicles are offered under NUST auto finance?
answer: Locally assembled/manufactured
New/Used vehicles
(Commercial vehicles or vehicles for commercial use cannot be financed)

qas.question: 5. How much loan can I avail?
answer: Up to a maximum of Rs.3 Million from all banks/DFIs in aggregate, subject to a maximum of 40% Debt Burden requirement.

qas.question: 6. What is maximum period of loan?
answer: Up to 1000 CC Vehicles                                       up to 5 Years
For Vehicles Greater than 1000 CC                     up to 3 Years

qas.question: 7. How much Equity/Down Payment is required?
answer: Minimum 30%  equity +(1st Year Insurance + documentation charges) is required as down payment

qas.question: 8. Can I avail more than one vehicle through Auto loan facility?
answer: Yes. Two vehicles can be availed simultaneously from NUST Bank, subject to Debt Burden Limitations
9. Can I avail Auto loan facility, if I am not a Salaried Person/Businessman/
Professional?
Yes. The individual  with  foreign remittance, supported by Bank statement  and remittance receipts can avail Auto Loan Facility

qas.question: 11. Is insurance of vehicle is mandatory?
answer: Yes. Comprehensive Insurance of vehicle is mandatory for the whole tenor of loan at the cost of the borrower
through any of the insurance companies listed with NUST Bank.

qas.question: 13. Who will insure my Vehicle?
answer: NUST Bank has insurance arrangements with reputed insurance companies with attractive insurance rate,
Free Tracker and Free Accidental Life insurance up to Rs.1 million.
Customer has to select insurance company of his/her choice from NUST Panel of insurance companies.

qas.question: 15. What is the security against the loan?
answer: Financed vehicle will be the security against the loan, which will be hypothecated in favour of NUST Bank.

qas.question: 16. Whether bank is responsible for delay in booking or delivery of vehicle?
answer: No. Bank does not assume any responsibility in this regard, as same is beyond the control of bank.

qas.question: 17. Whether bank is responsible for any type of dispute related to Warranty/Fault in vehicle/Service issues with Dealership or vehicle Manufacturer?
answer: No. Bank does not assume this responsibility. Customer will take up the matter directly with dealership or manufacturer.

qas.question: 18. What is the Loan Application processing time?
answer: The processing time for loan approval is approximately 11 working days, subject to complete application with required documents/formalities.

qas.question: 19. How can I apply for loan?
answer: You can apply by visiting any of our  Branch or by calling us at 24 hours Contact Centre at 111-000-787.
Our dedicated staff will help you to complete your loan application and other formalities.

- Principal amount x 1.5% per annum on the remaining period of the Term Deposits
(for e.g., deal booked for 5 years matured after 2 years – penalty/charges will be 4.5% x Principal Amount)
- Minimum penalty/charges are 1.5% of the principal amount. The penalty amount will be to the extent of profit paid/payable only
https://NUSTbank.com/NUSTUploads/uploads/SOC-Conv-English.pdf

qas.question: What are the free services offered on NUST Sahar Asaan Current Account ?

- Free Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer)
- Free Banker’s Cheque Issuance
- Free I-Net Banking
- Free E-statement
- Free SMS Alerts on digital transactions

qas.question: 13. Is there a limit to international Spending?
answer: As per SBP directives i.e. Nov 1, 2022 industry-wide annual maximum limit of USD 30,000/- per individual on card-based
(debit/credit and virtual cards) cross-border transactions

It is the primary responsibility of a customer to ensure that his/her annual limit is not breached at any time. Note: NUST Bank has the right to reject any application as per Bank’s criteria.

qas.question: Is NUST Bank offering any financing specifically for the ownership & capacity enhancement of business premises?
answer: NUST Bank has structured a new financing product “NUST Imarat Finance” under the ambit of SME segment. The Product Program has been developed in order to stabilize SME business through making their ownership of business premises (under mortgage finance of urban commercial / industrial buildings) for capacity enhancement of SMEs.The product has been structured for SMEs owned by general public as well as retired armed forces officers and families of serving officers.

qas.question: For which purpose NUST Imarat Finance is being offered?
answer:
AIF 1:   Acquisition / Purchase of urban commercial / industrial construted property/ office and commercial premises for commercial / business activity
AIF 2:   Construction on self owned urban commercial / Industrial plot
AIF 3:   Additional construction on already built urban commercial/ industrial plaza/building
AIF 4:   Renovation of self owned urban commercial /industrial property/Plaza/ business premises

qas.question: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Imarat Finance?
answer:
AIF 1:   Mininum Rs. 5.00 M & Maximum Rs. 100M 
AIF 2:   Mininum Rs. 5.00 M & Maximum Rs. 50M 
AIF 3:   Maximum Rs. 30M or upto 30% of FSV of offered property, whichever is lower
AIF 4:   Maximum Rs. 5M or upto 25% of FSV of offered property, whichever is lower

qas.question: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Imarat Finance?

AIF 2:  Maximum 10 Years(Grace Period upto 9 months)
AIF 3:  Maximum 8 Years (Grace Period upto 6 months)
AIF 4:  Maximum 03 Years (Grace Period upto 3 months)
(markup to be recovered during grace period)

qas.question: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?
answer:
AIF 1 & AIF 2: Minimum 30%  (Existing business) & Minimum 40% (New Business)
AIF 3 & AIF 4 : Nil for Existing business & Minimum 25% (New Business)

qas.question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Imarat Finance?
answer:
New Business
Minimum 30 years at the time of application, however age not to exceed 60 years at maturity of loan.  
 Existing Business 
Minimum 30 years at the time of application however age not to exceed 65 years at maturity of loan.

qas.question: Any mandatory qualification/experience required?
answer:
Specifically for New Business: 
i)	Only Professionals i.e. Chartered Accountants, Doctors, Engineers, IT Professionals, and consultants etc, with minimum 02 years professional experience. 
ii)	Retired professionals from armed forces and families of serving armed forces officers
*No Professional Qualification Required for existing business

qas.question: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Imarat Finance?
answer:
General Regular SME’s 
End-user Rate: 12MK+4% p.a. (to be reviewed on annual basis)

SME’s Backed By Armed Forces
End-user Rate: 12MK+2.5 p.a. (to be reviewed on annual basis)

qas.question: Is there any business age requirement?
answer: Existing Business Minimum 03 year operating history of business

qas.question: What should be the legal structure of business for availing  NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: Sole Proprietor, Partnership Firm(registered), Private Limited Company, Limited Company

qas.question: What is the security requirement for availing NUST Imarat Finance?

i.	Effective Mortgage (Equitable / or token registered) to be created on same urban Commercial / Industrial property which has been financed
ii.	03 post dated cheques of the full loan amount plus markup
iii.	Personal Guarantees from borrowers, all partners and directors of the companies alongwith “Personal Net worth Statement”.
iv.	Fard based property to be registered equivalent to the full loan amount

qas.question: What is the repayment frequency in NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: Monthly/Quarterly

qas.question: Is there any condition related to bank account maintenance for availing NUST Imarat Finance?
answer:
Minimum 01 year bank account statement with NUST
                                       Or
Minimum 02 years bank statement with any other bank

qas.question: Is there any penalty charges related to Premature termination/balloon payment penalties?
answer: Mode of Pre-Mature termination
General Category
Armed Forces Category
i. In case entire outstanding loan is adjusted within 03 years of first disbursement
At 3% of the total outstanding loan amount
At 2% of the total outstanding loan amount
ii. In case entire outstanding loan is adjusted after 03 years
At 2% of the total outstanding loan amount
At 1% of the total outstanding loan amount
iii. Balloon Payment
Balloon Payment upto 20% of loan outstanding amount is allowed once in each year without penalty. Adjustment of over and above 20% will be charged @ 2% of balloon payment Amount

Balloon payment upto 30% of loan outstanding amount is allowed once in each year without penalty. 
Adjustment of over and above 30% will be charged @1% of balloon payment amount
*Premature termination penalty will not be applicable in case of renovation

qas.question: Is NUST Bank offering any seasonal financing?

The product has been designed for Flour Mills in order to meet their working capital needs. NUST Flour Mill Finance caters to meet seasonal financing needs of wheat procurement and other overhead expenses to flour mills. The scope of product is to target flour mills which fall under category of SME.

Cash Finance (CF)

Running Finance (RF)
To meet working capital requirements i.e. transportation, salary & wages, utility and other administrative expenses etc. (Procurement of wheat through RF funds is restricted)

* This criteria is not applicable , if business concern is a partnership or limited company

qas.question: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: Maximum 1 year as per clean-up corridors

qas.question: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer:
Cash Finance
3 Months average KIBOR + 3% p.a.

Running Finance
3 Months average KIBOR + 3.5% p.a.
(reviewed/revised on quarterly basis)

qas.question: Any Account turnover requirement for NUST Flour Mill Finance?

PMYB &ALS.title: Prime Minister Youth Business & Agriculture Loan Scheme

qas.question: Is NUST Bank Participating in PMYB & ALS?
answer: NUST Bank is actively participating in PMYB&ALS. It has been specially designed to provide self-employment opportunity to the unemployed youth of the country who have skills, knowledge, experience or willingness to start their own businesses on small to medium scale or expand existing business on vast scale.

qas.question: For which purposes PMYB & ALS is being offered?
answer:
•	To start new business 
•	To expand existing business

qas.question: Nature of loans allowed in PMYB & ALS?
answer:
•	Long term / Development Loans
•	Working capital / Production Loans

qas.question: What are the Loan Limits of PMYB & ALS?
answer:
Tier 2
 Above Rs. 0.5M and up to Rs 1.5M

Tier 3
   Above Rs 1.5 M and up to Rs 7.5M

qas.question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in PMYB & ALS and any mandatory qualification/experience required?
answer: All Pakistanis aged between 21 and 45 are eligible to apply, however for IT/E-Commerce related businesses, the lower age limit will be 18 years (at least matriculation or equivalent education will be required)

qas.question: What is the maximum tenure in PMYB & ALS?
answer: Long Term Loan:  Maximum 8 Years (Maximum 1 Year Grace Period)
Working Capital Loan:  Maximum 05 Years (Maximum 2 Year Grace Period)
*Markup will be recovered during grace period

qas.question: What is the current Mark-up rate of PMYB & ALS?
answer:
Tier 2
     5% per annum

Tier 3
   7% per annum

qas.question: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?
answer:
Tier 2
10% (New Business)

Tier 3
   20% (New Business)

Existing Business
 Nil

qas.question: What is the repayment frequency in PMYB & ALS?
answer: Repayment of PMYB&ALS loans will be made in the form of “monthly or quarterly Instalments (or as per SBP’s directives)

qas.question: What is the security requirement for availing PMYB & ALS?
answer:
Tier 2
i.	Clean; personal guarantee of the borrower
ii.	02 Post Dated cheques for installment amount 
iii.	01 Post Dated cheque for full loan amount plus mark up as per amortization schedule

Tier 3
i.	Mortgage of residential / commercial / industrial property owned by borrower or third party
ii.	HPA on vehicle in the name of borrower or immediate family member i.e. parents, spouse, children, brothers or sisters.
iii.	Liquid security (lien on deposit, Saving certificates, TDRs etc.)

qas.question: Is there any quota for womens?
answer: 25% of the loans will go to women borrowers

qas.question: What are the processing charges for PMYB & ALS?
What are the service/documentation/legal charges in PMYB & ALS?
answer: At actual

qas.question: Is there any late payment charges?
answer: PKR 1,000/- plus FED per instance per installment, grace period included. (Late Payment to be triggered 15 days after installment becomes due i.e. on day 16)

qas.question: Is NUST Bank offering any seasonal financing for rice mills?
answer: NUST Rice Finance caters to meet seasonal financing needs of paddy procurement and other overhead expenses to rice mills, based on past performance and milling capacity to fulfil their seasonal financial needs. The scope of the product is to target ‘Rice Mills’ which fall under the category of SME.

qas.question: For which purposes NUST Rice Finance is being offered?
answer:
Cash Finance (CF)
To meet working capital requirements of Rice Husking Mills for procurement of paddy as per milling capacity.

Running Finance (RF)
To meet working capital requirements of Rice Husking Mills i.e. transportation, salary & wages, utility and other administrative expenses etc.(Procurement of Paddy through RF funds is restricted)

qas.question: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Rice Finance?
answer:
ME: Upto Rs.200M (Maximum)
SE:   Upto Rs.25M (Maximum)

qas.question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Rice Finance?
answer:
Minimum 20 years (in case of sole proprietorship)
Maximum 65 years at the time of application.

* This criteria is not applicable if business concern is a partnership or limited company
*This age can be relaxed in case of effective succession planning is available.

qas.question: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Rice Finance?
answer:
Cash Finance
Max 270 Days or Clean-up corridors whichever is earlier

Running Finance
One Year

qas.question: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Rice Finance?
answer:
Cash Finance
3 Months KIBOR + Up to 3.00% p.a

Running Finance
3 Months KIBOR + Up to  3.50% p.a
(reviewed/revised on quarterly basis)

qas.question: Any Account turnover requirement for NUST Rice Finance?
answer: Minimum 50% of applicant’s sales to be documented through account turnover with bank(s).

qas.question: What are the processing charges for NUST Rice Finance Application?
answer: Processing fee will be charged @ 0.15% of total limit(s) processed/approved or Rs. 25,000/- whichever is higher

qas.question: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Rice Finance?
answer: At actual

answer: At actual

qas.question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Hunarmand Finance?

qas.question: What is Home Remittance ?
answer: Home Remittance Service enables remitters to send money from abroad to Pakistan instantly, conveniently, and safely through the legal banking channel.

qas.question: What types of Inward Home Remittance products does NUST Bank offer ?
answer:
NUST  offers the following Home Remittance Products to cater to the needs of various home remittance
beneficiaries in Pakistan:
• Cash Over the Counter (CoC) payments for walk-in customers
• NUST Account Transfer
• Other Bank Account Transfer via Inter Bank Funds Transfer (IBFT) & Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS)

qas.question: In which currency will I receive my remittance?
answer: All home remittance payments are disbursed in Pak Rupees.

qas.question: Is there any limit on the amount received though NUST Home Remittance?
answer:
Below are the applicable limits:
• NUST Accounts - No Limit
• Other banks accounts - No Limit
• Cash Over the Counter (CoC) Transactions - Up to PKR 1,000,000/- per transaction and there is no limit of Western Union COC transactions

qas.question: Are there any charges/fee for NUST's Home Remittance Service?
answer: NUST Home Remittance Service is free of charge.

qas.question: Are there any tax deductions on Home Remittances?
answer: Home Remittance Service is free of taxes.

qas.question: Can I receive remittance in Pakistan if I do not have a bank account with any bank?
answer: You can receive your home remittance from any of NUST 600+ domestic branches nationwide if you have a valid CNIC and Transaction Unique Reference No. / Pin code.

qas.question: Is there any list of branches I can access to get information?
answer: The list of NUST domestic branches can be viewed from the Branch Locator available on our corporate website www.nustbank.com .
https://NUSTbank.com/find-us/

qas.question: Who should I contact in case I need to lodge a complaint regarding Home Remittance?
answer:
For any query/complaint regarding Home Remittance, you may contact our dedicated Remittance Service Centre at UAN# 021-111-000-787. 
You may also email your queries/complaints at remittance@NUSTbank.com.pk

qas.question: How can I obtain a Proceed Realization Certificate (PRC)/Encashment Certificate against remittance(s) received? Who should I contact?
answer:
Please find below contact details for obtaining a PRC and e-PRC:
 •  e-PRC option is also available at the NUST website https://secureportal.NUSTbank.com/eprc/customer to obtain a system generated PRC on your registered email address.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
 • Proceeds Realization Certificate (PRC) is issued from NUST Centralized Remittance Department. You may contact them at the following email addresses:
remittance.prc@NUSTbank.com.pk

qas.question: Can I track my remittance status online?
answer: Yes, you can view the status of your remittance online through NUST Remittance Tracker by following link https://NUSTbank.com/services/alternate-delivery-channels/home-remittance-tracking/

qas.question: What are NUST's Banking hours to avail home remittance services from NUST Branches?
answer:
Customers can avail home remittance services from NUST domestic branches during regular business hours appended below:
• Monday to Thursday: 09:00 am to 05:00 pm
• Friday: 09:00 am to 05:30 pm
• Saturday: 09:00 am to 01:30 pm (through selected branches)

qas.question: Is it important to declare the purpose of the funds being sent to Pakistan?
answer: Yes, it is mandatory to provide purpose of funds being sent to Pakistan.

qas.question: I am a foreign national, can I send money to Pakistan?
answer: Yes, you can.

qas.question: Does the PRI comes under the laws of State Bank or Government?
answer: It is a joint initiative of  State Bank of Pakistan, Ministry of overseas Pakistanis and Ministry of Finance.

qas.question: Can the Freelance payment  be made through PRI?
answer: Yes Freelance payments is allowed under specfic arrangemnts with Tie-ups with allowed purposes as per SBP guidelines.

qas.question: What conversion rates will be applied on remittance?
answer: The same conversion rates will be applied at the time of sending the remittance. Affiliated bank or Exchange Company confirm the Conversion rates to Sender at the time of sending the remittance.

qas.question: Does NUST Bank has specialized remittance Account as per SBP guideline?
answer: Yes NUST has remittance account name as Pak Wattan Remittance Account.

qas.question: Who can open Pak Wattan Remittance Account?
answer: A Bonafide recipient of Home remittance (PRI) can open this account.

qas.question: Can remittance be sent from anywhere to Pakistan?
answer:
Yes, remittance can be sent from around the globe to Pakistan through our agent Partners like Western Union, Mastercard, Dandelion Payments (RIA) etc. 
For more information please go through the below link:
https://NUSTbank.com/services-home-remittance-our-partners/
